definitions.definition: Any member of the family Cactaceae, a family of flowering New World succulent plants suited to a hot, semi-desert climate.
Any succulent plant with a thick fleshy stem bearing spines but no leaves, such as euphorbs.
A mythical, nocturnal creature; a hobgoblin.
Any imagined fear or threat, or a fear presumed larger than it really is.
The process by which air is circulated through or mixed with a substance such as soil or a liquid.
A feeler organ on the head of an insect, crab, or other animal.
An apparatus to receive or transmit electromagnetic waves and convert respectively to or from an electrical signal.
The faculty of intuitive astuteness.
A fragment of an oligosaccharide
The spar to which a lateen sail is attached, which is then hoisted up the mast.
To react, using fermentation; especially to produce alcohol by aging or by allowing yeast to act on sugars; to brew.
To stir up, agitate, cause unrest or excitement in.
Produced by fermentation.
Of food or drink, turned sour due to unwanted fermentation.
A thick, creamy soup or stew.
A stew, particularly fish or seafood, not necessarily thickened.
A seller of fish.
To make (seafood, etc.) into chowder.
One who lives outside their own country.
An ornament to be placed in the centre, as of a table, ceiling, etc.
A central article or figure.
To make greatly distressed and/or a discomposed appearance
To be placed or place someone under the influence of a psychedelic drug
To streak; to variegate
To experience reality withdrawal, or hallucinations (nightmarish), to behave irrational or unconventional due to drug use.
To react extremely or irrationally, usually under distress or discomposure
A male school principal.
A concrete margin along the edge of a road; a kerb (UK, Australia, New Zealand)
A raised margin along the edge of something, such as a well or the eye of a dome, as a strengthening.
Something that checks or restrains; a restraint.

A riding or driving bit for a horse that has rein action which amplifies the pressure in the mouth by leverage advantage placing pressure on the poll via the crown piece of the bridle and chin groove via a curb chain.
A sidewalk, covered or partially enclosed, bordering the airport terminal road system with adjacent paved areas to permit vehicles to off-load or load passengers.
A swelling on the back part of the hind leg of a horse, just behind the lowest part of the hock joint, generally causing lameness.
A large Arctic marine mammal related to seals and having long tusks, tough, wrinkled skin, and four flippers, Odobenus rosmarus.
Having an inclination to secrecy
Relating to secretion
Causing grief, pain or sorrow.
Serious, grave, dire or dangerous.
Any of a group of naturally occurring lipids derived from the C20 acid prostanoic acid; they have a number of physiological functions and may be considered to be hormones.
Having the power of generating, propagating, originating, or producing.
Pertaining to the hippocampus.
The act or an instance of repeating or being repeated.
: The act of performing a single, controlled exercise motion. A group of repetitions is a set.
Someone who lives on a pension, especially the retirement or old age pension.
(by extension) Someone who is at the age at which one typically receives a pension; an elderly person.
(Cambridge University) A student who is not dependent on any foundation for support, but pays all university charges; at Oxford called a commoner.
To speak with a spasmodic repetition of vocal sounds.
definitions.example: He stuttered a few words of thanks.

definitions.definition: To exhaust a gas with difficulty
definitions.example: The engine of the old car stuttered going up the slope. I was stuttering after the marathon.

definitions.definition: A speech disorder in which the flow of speech is disrupted by involuntary repetitions and prolongations of sounds, syllables, words or phrases, and by involuntary silent pauses or blocks in which the stutterer is unable to produce sounds.
An instance of stuttering.
That stutters.
Hesitant.
With either physical of coercive force; in a forceful manner; vigorously; powerfully.
Fascinated by something; entranced as if by a spell.
definitions.example: The story left the children spellbound.

definitions.definition: Something thought to bring good luck
definitions.example: I keep this red stone as a lucky mascot and always put it on my desk in exams.,

definitions.definition: Something, especially a person or animal, used to symbolize a sports team, company, organization or other group
definitions.example: Tommy the Tyke is the mascot of Barnsley FC.

definitions.definition: A difficult question or riddle, especially one using a play on words in the answer.
A difficult choice or decision that must be made.
Relating to comedy.
Self-support; taking care of one's own well-being.
An enemy; fiend; the Devil.
To take care of oneself; to take responsibility for one's own well-being.
(except as "fend for oneself") To defend, to take care of (typically construed with for); to block or push away (typically construed with off).
A sound produced by obstructing the air passage with the tip of the tongue.
Of or connected with the apex.
(of a meristem) Situated at the growing tip of the plant or its roots, in comparison with intercalary growth situated between zones of permanent tissue.
(of a sound) Produced with the tip of the tongue.
Of or relating to a synopsis.
(especially of meteorological data) Obtained simultaneously over a wide area, for presenting a comprehensive and nearly instantaneous picture of the state of the atmosphere.
Pertaining to the gospels of Matthew, Mark and Luke.
A clear deep blue variety of corundum, valued as a precious stone.
A white, yellow, or purple variety of corundum, either clear or translucent.
A deep blue colour.
Any hummingbird in the genera Hylocharis and Chlorestes, as well as the rufous-throated sapphire, which is now in the genus Amazilia.
Any of the butterflies in the southern Asian lycaenid genus Heliophorus.
The chemical element (symbol Be) with an atomic number of 4; a soft silvery-white low density alkaline earth metal with specialist industrial applications.
An atom of this element.
A substance that kills germs and/or viruses.
definitions.example: The scalpels were soaked in disinfectant before the operation so disease wouldn't be spread.

definitions.definition: Serving to kill germs or viruses.
definitions.example: I washed repeatedly with a disinfectant soap but I still caught the flu.

definitions.definition: To make smaller; to press or squeeze together, or to make something occupy a smaller space or volume.
definitions.example: The force required to compress a spring varies linearly with the displacement.

definitions.definition: To be pressed together or folded by compression into a more economic, easier format.
definitions.example: Our new model compresses easily, ideal for storage and travel

definitions.definition: To condense into a more economic, easier format.
definitions.example: This chart compresses the entire audit report into a few lines on a single diagram.

definitions.definition: To abridge.
definitions.example: If you try to compress the entire book into a three-sentence summary, you will lose a lot of information.

definitions.definition: To make digital information smaller by encoding it using fewer bits.
To embrace sexually.
A person who makes jokes.
A funny person.
A jester.
A playing card that features a picture of a joker (that is, a jester) and that may be used as a wild card in some card games.
An unspecified, vaguely disreputable person.
definitions.example: Some joker keeps throwing eggs at my windows.

definitions.definition: A man.
A clause in a contract that undermines its apparent provisions.
A young pig
In card games, a card that can be assigned any value or used to substitute for any needed card.
A competitor or team that is allowed to compete in a tournament despite not reaching the normal standards to qualify for inclusion.
definitions.example: Kye Sun-Hui won an Olympic gold medal in Judo, despite being a wild card.

definitions.definition: A character that substitutes for other characters in regular expressions and globbing
A character that takes the place of any other character or string that is not known or specified.
definitions.example: If the character * is acting as a wildcard, then the pattern a*m matches each of the words amalgam, atom and alum.

definitions.definition: (also written wild card) An uncontrolled or unpredictable element.
(also written wild card) An element, often deliberately concealed, which is withheld for contingency.
To stupefy by doping with chemical substances such as alcohol.
To excite to enthusiasm or madness.
(of a substance) Able to intoxicate; an intoxicant.
Very exciting and stimulating, like alcohol or some other stimulant.
A dessert of British origin containing stewed fruit topped with a crumbly mixture of fat, flour, and sugar.
definitions.example: blackberry and apple crumble

definitions.definition: To fall apart; to disintegrate.
definitions.example: The empire crumbled when the ruler's indiscretions came to light.

definitions.definition: To break into crumbs.
definitions.example: We crumbled some bread into the water.

definitions.definition: To mix (ingredients such as flour and butter) in such a way as to form crumbs.
definitions.example: Using your fingers, crumble the ingredients with the fingertips, lifting in an upward motion, until the mixture is sandy and resembles large breadcrumbs.

definitions.definition: A book or pad with blank pages for sketching; a sketch pad.
A book of printed sketches.
A printed book of literary sketches or skits.
To have recourse (to), now especially from necessity or frustration.
To fall back; to revert.
To make one's way, go (to).
To repeat a sorting process; sort again.
To teach (somebody) by giving a speech on a given topic.
definitions.example: The professor lectured to two classes this morning.

definitions.definition: To preach, to berate, to scold.
definitions.example: Emily's father lectured her about the importance of being home before midnight.

definitions.definition: The act of delivering a lecture or harangue.
To treat or deal with (a topic) again or differently.
To apply treatment to (an injury, a surface, etc.) again
To withdraw from a position, go back.
(of a glacier) To shrink back due to generally warmer temperatures.
To slope back.
definitions.example: a retreating forehead

definitions.definition: An icicle.
(usually plural) The crest of a cock.
A woodpecker.
A kitchen utensil consisting of a flat surface attached to a long handle, used for turning, lifting or stirring food.
A kitchen utensil consisting of a flexible surface attached to a long handle, used for scraping the sides of bowls.
A palette knife.
A thin hand tool, often made of nickel, for handling chemicals or other materials, when weighing, etc.
A croupier's tool for turning up cards in a casino.
A sclerotized, T-shaped plate in the prothorax of larvae of flies belonging to family Cecidomyiidae, the gall midges.
Between or across generations.
Provisions; food; viands; especially, luxurious food; delicacies; dainties.
A relatively short feature film.
A short film of bonus material, companion to the main feature, frequently part of additional material in a home video release on LaserDisc, DVD, Blu-Ray.
A potential problem or source of trouble.
definitions.example: Review the work thoroughly and make sure there are no gotchas.

definitions.definition: An instance of publicly tricking someone or exposing them to ridicule, especially by means of an elaborate deception.
An instance of accomplishing a tricky idea or overcoming a difficult obstacle.
definitions.example: Now here's another few gotchas that you can do to implement it.

definitions.definition: A feature of a system or a program that works in the way it is documented but is counter-intuitive and almost invites mistake or non-function.
definitions.example: Wireless was the first gotcha when installing the distro.

definitions.definition: (sometimes derogatory) A person who moves from place to place or job to job.
A type of lightweight sail used in light winds like a spinnaker.
A driver who uses driving techniques to modify vehicle traction to cause a vehicle to slide or power slide rather than drive in line with the tires.
One who takes part in drift fishing.
A boat used for drift fishing.
A parachutist who jumps before the rest of the group to determine the environmental conditions.
A person employed in driving in rock other than coal.
To let out (a sail-line), to allow (a sheet) to run out.
To change direction or course suddenly; to swerve.
definitions.example: The car slid on the ice and veered out of control.

definitions.definition: (of the wind) To shift in a clockwise direction (if in the Northern Hemisphere, or in a counterclockwise direction if in the Southern Hemisphere).
(of the wind) To shift aft.
To change direction into the wind; to wear ship.
To turn.
A turn or swerve; an instance of veering.
To catch by means of a net.
To catch in a trap, or by stratagem.
To enclose or cover with a net.
definitions.example: to net a tree

definitions.definition: To score (a goal).
definitions.example: Evans netted the winner in the 80th minute.

definitions.definition: To hit the ball into the net.
To form network or netting; to knit.
To receive as profit.
definitions.example: The company nets $30 on every sale.

definitions.definition: To yield as profit for.
definitions.example: The scam netted the criminals $30,000.

definitions.definition: To fully hedge a position.
definitions.example: Every party is netting their position with a counter-party

definitions.definition: The status or position of a performer acknowledged to be a star; fame; celebrity.
An act or instance of dispelling.
To drive away or cause to vanish by scattering.
To remove (fears, doubts, objections etc.) by proving them unjustified.
A person who introduces speakers, and proposes toasts at a formal dinner; a master of ceremonies.
Any ship built or armed for naval combat.
A recommendation or suggestion.
A recreation ground.
Any activity, such as play, that amuses, diverts or stimulates.
The process of recreating something.
The result of this process.
An organism that is exotic to an environment.
An exotic dancer; a stripteaser.
Any exotic particle.
definitions.example: Glueballs, theoretical particles composed only of gluons, are exotics.

definitions.definition: To make clear or effective.
To speak clearly; to enunciate.
definitions.example: I wish he’d articulate his words more clearly.

definitions.definition: To explain; to put into words; to make something specific.
definitions.example: I like this painting, but I can’t articulate why.

definitions.definition: To bend or hinge something at intervals, or to allow or build something so that it can bend.
definitions.example: an articulated bus

definitions.definition: To attack a note, as by tonguing, slurring, bowing, etc.
definitions.example: Articulate that passage heavily.

definitions.definition: To form a joint or connect by joints
definitions.example: The lower jaw articulates with the skull at the temporomandibular joint.

definitions.definition: To treat or make terms.
A very short, unspecified length of time.
definitions.example: I’ll be back in a jiffy.

definitions.definition: A unit of time defined by the frequency of its basic timer – historically, and by convention, 0.01 of a second, but some computer operating systems use other values.
The length of an alternating current power cycle (1/60 or 1/50 of a second).
The time taken for light to travel a specified distance in a vacuum, usually one centimetre, but sometimes one foot or the width of a nucleon.
Short for jiffy bag, a padded envelope.
Any of several climbing vines, especially the honeysuckle and the Virginia creeper
To cause to become straight.
To become straight.
To put in order; to sort; to tidy up.
definitions.example: to straighten one's affairs, or an account

definitions.definition: To clarify a situation or concept to (an audience).
To bribe or corrupt.
To stand up, especially from a sitting position.
The act of making something straight.
To put under the surface of a liquid; to dunk.
definitions.example: Archimedes determined the volume of objects by immersing them in water.

definitions.definition: To involve or engage deeply.
definitions.example: The sculptor immersed himself in anatomic studies.

definitions.definition: To map into an immersion.
Immersed; buried; sunk.
Feeling or exhibiting envy; jealously desiring the excellence or good fortune of another; maliciously grudging
definitions.example: an envious man, disposition, or attack; envious tongues

definitions.definition: Excessively careful; cautious.
Malignant; mischievous; spiteful.
Inspiring envy.
To feel sorry about (a thing that has or has not happened), afterthink: to wish that a thing had not happened, that something else had happened instead.
definitions.example: He regretted his words.

definitions.definition: (more generally) To feel sorry about (any thing).
definitions.example: I regret that I have to do this, but I don't have a choice.

definitions.definition: To miss; to feel the loss or absence of.
Severe pains that grip the abdomen or the disease that causes such pains (due to intestinal or bowel-related problems).
A medicinal plant used to relieve such symptoms.
Relating to the colon; colonic.
To bound or spring back from a force.
To give back an echo.
To jump up or get back up again.
To send back; to reverberate.
The act of something that rebounds.
Covered in hair or bristles; hairy.
Deviation from what is right; gross injustice, sin, wickedness.
An act of great injustice or unfairness; a sinful or wicked act; an unconscionable deed.
Something preliminary, such as a trial, report, race, etc.
Preliminary
Before going to press.
To trick; to deceive
To act in an idiotic manner; to act foolishly
The act of one who fools.

An army of trained civilians, which may be an official reserve army, called upon in time of need, the entire able-bodied population of a state which may also be called upon, or a private force not under government control.
The police in the Soviet Union and some related or successor states (e.g. modern Belarus).
A naval officer holding a rank between captain and rear admiral.
A (temporary) commander over a collection of ships who is not an admiral.
The leading ship in a fleet of merchantmen.
The president of a yacht club.
A yacht-club president's vessel in a regatta.
A commodore admiral.
A rear admiral (lower half).
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the Asian genus Parasarpa.
To build as, or cover with a vault.
To jump or leap over.
definitions.example: The fugitive vaulted over the fence to escape.

definitions.definition: Of a ceiling supported by arches, introduced in the Gothic style.
The act of warming, or the state of being warmed; a heating.
definitions.example: Shall I give your coffee a warm in the microwave?

definitions.definition: To make or keep warm.
To become warm, to heat up.
definitions.example: My socks are warming by the fire.

definitions.definition: To favour increasingly.
definitions.example: He is warming to the idea.

definitions.definition: To become ardent or animated.
definitions.example: The speaker warms as he proceeds.

definitions.definition: To make engaged or earnest; to interest; to engage; to excite ardor or zeal in; to enliven.
To beat or spank.
The state of being formal.
Something said or done as a matter of form.
A customary ritual without new or unique meaning.
(countable) A specific requirement for obtaining a legal status, conducting a transaction, etc.
Ectopic beat or pregnancy.
Relating to ectopia.
Being out of place, having an abnormal position.
The action of the verb to resound
Having a deep, rich sound; mellow and resonant.
That causes reverberation.
(by extension) Emphatic.
definitions.example: We had a resounding win against the rival team.

definitions.definition: To echo (a sound) or again sound.
To reverberate with sound or noise.
definitions.example: The street resounded with the noise of the children's game.

definitions.definition: To make a reverberating sound.
definitions.example: The sound of the brass band resounded through the town.

definitions.definition: To be much mentioned.
To throw back, or return, the sound of; to echo.
To praise or celebrate with the voice, or the sound of instruments; to extol with sounds; to spread the fame of.
In the International System of Units, the derived unit of electric charge; the amount of electric charge carried by a current of 1 ampere flowing for 1 second. Symbol: C
definitions.example: He is charged up with enough coulombs to make his hair stand on end.

definitions.definition: The act of restating.
A second or subsequent statement.
The board one stands on for wakeboarding.
To take part in wakeboarding.
Not scheduled; impromptu
Similar to sauce; having the consistency or texture of sauce.
Impertinent or disrespectful, often in a manner that is regarded as entertaining or amusing; smart.
definitions.example: She is a loud, saucy child who doesn't show a lot of respect to her elders.

definitions.definition: Impudently bold; pert.
Sharp; pungent; piquant.
Mildly erotic.
definitions.example: I enjoyed the dancing, but my wife found it a little too saucy.

definitions.definition: To raise blisters on.
definitions.example: a chemical agent that blisters the skin

definitions.definition: To have a blister form.
To criticise severely.
To break out in blisters.
The practice of forming blisters on the skin, to promote blood flow and aid healing.
Causing blisters
Very hot
Harsh or corrosive
Scornful
Very fast
Someone thought to have an unusual degree of enlightenment.
To shine light on something.
To decorate something with lights.
To clarify or make something understandable.
To decorate the page of a manuscript book with ornamental designs.
To make spectacular.
To glow; to light up.
To be exposed to light.
To direct a radar beam toward.

A transducer consisting of two different metals welded together at each end; a voltage is produced that is proportional to the difference in temperature between the two junctions (one of which is normally held at a known temperature)
Any of many blends of spices used in Indian cuisine, most often containing cardamom, coriander, mace together with pepper, nutmeg, fennel seeds, jeera etc.
A coin formerly used in the United Kingdom, Ireland, Malta, Australia, New Zealand and many other Commonwealth countries.
definitions.example: The shilling was worth twelve old pence, or one twentieth of a pound sterling.

definitions.definition: The currency of Kenya, Somalia, Tanzania and Uganda.
A currency in the United States, differing in value between states.
(New York and some other states) The Spanish real, formerly having the value of one eighth of a dollar.
To collect (grain, grapes, etc.) left behind after the main harvest or gathering.
To gather what is left in (a field or vineyard).
definitions.example: to glean a field

definitions.definition: To gather information in small amounts, with implied difficulty, bit by bit.
To frugally accumulate resources from low-yield contexts.
To separate or break down something into its components; to disintegrate or fragment
To rot, decay or putrefy
Pertaining to flowers.
Decorated with or abundant in flowers.
(of a speech or piece of writing) overly complicated or elaborate; with grandiloquent expressions
Wrong, immoral, causing a scandal
Malicious, defamatory.
Outrageous; exceeding reasonable limits.
A lemur.
Makizushi, a form of sushi that is rolled.
A burn on the skin caused by excess exposure to the sun's rays.
A burn on the tissue of crop plants or their fruits (especially if they are rich in water like tomatoes, grapes, apples, gooseberries) caused by excess exposure to the sun's rays.
To receive a sunburn.
To burn or tan (someone's skin) by the sun; to allow (a part of one's body) to become sunburnt.
A small quantity of something edible or a potable liquor.
definitions.example: He had a nip of whiskey.

definitions.definition: A nipple, usually of a woman.
definitions.example: Did you manage to sneak a peek at her nips, bro?

definitions.definition: A playful bite.
definitions.example: The puppy gave his owner’s finger a nip.

definitions.definition: A pinch with the nails or teeth.
Briskly cold weather.
definitions.example: There is a nip in the air. It is nippy outside.

definitions.definition: A seizing or closing in upon; a pinching
definitions.example: the nip of masses of ice

definitions.definition: A small cut, or a cutting off the end.
A more or less gradual thinning out of a stratum.
A blast; a killing of the ends of plants by frost.
A biting sarcasm; a taunt.
A short turn in a rope.
(papermaking) The place of intersection where one roll touches another
A pickpocket.
To catch and enclose or compress tightly between two surfaces, or points which are brought together or closed; to pinch; to close in upon.
To remove by pinching, biting, or cutting with two meeting edges of anything; to clip.
To blast, as by frost; to check the growth or vigor of; to destroy.
To annoy, as by nipping.
To taunt.
To squeeze or pinch.
To steal; especially to cut a purse.
To make a quick, short journey or errand, usually a round trip.
definitions.example: Why don’t you nip down to the grocer’s for some milk?

definitions.definition: A cylindrical or rectangular container usually of lightweight metal, plastic, or laminated pasteboard used for holding a dry product (as tea, crackers, flour, matches).
Any of various cylindrical metal receptacles usually with a removable close-fitting top.

A special short range antipersonnel projectile consisting of a casing of light metal, loaded with preformed submissiles such as flechettes or steel balls. The casing is designed to open just beyond the muzzle of the weapon, dispersing the submissiles.
A component of canister type protective mask containing a mechanical filter and chemical filling to filter, neutralize and/or absorb toxic chemical, biological and radiological agents.
A projectile component containing colored or screening smoke or riot control agent composition.
To make threats against (someone); to intimidate.
definitions.example: to menace a country with war

definitions.definition: To threaten (an evil to be inflicted).
To endanger (someone or something); to imperil or jeopardize.
The act of making menaces or threats.
Suggesting imminent harm.
Threatening.
A person eligible to vote in an election; a member of an electorate, a voter.
A spiritual part of the soul in Egyptian mythology, which survived after death.
The state of having enough funds or liquid assets to pay all of one's debts; the state of being solvent.
A person who has a neurosis
Affected with a neurosis.
Overly anxious.
definitions.example: He is getting neurotic about time-keeping.

definitions.definition: Useful in disorders of, or affecting, the nerves.
To intercept or catch (a ball) and play it.
(and other batting sports) To be the team catching and throwing the ball, as opposed to hitting it.
definitions.example: The blue team are fielding first, while the reds are batting.

definitions.definition: To place (a team, its players, etc.) in a game.
definitions.example: The away team fielded two new players and the second-choice goalkeeper.

definitions.definition: To answer; to address.
definitions.example: She will field questions immediately after her presentation.

definitions.definition: To defeat.
definitions.example: They fielded a fearsome army.

definitions.definition: To execute research (in the field).
definitions.example: He fielded the marketing survey about the upcoming product.

definitions.definition: To deploy in the field.
definitions.example: to field a new land-mine detector

definitions.definition: Bituminous coal.
A type or grade of bituminous coal.
Of or pertaining to bitumen.
Turned or twisted to one side.
Untoward, unfavourable.
Tilted to one side.
definitions.example: He wore his hat askew

definitions.definition: Any species of fish of the family Tetraodontidae that have the ability to inflate themselves to a globe several times their normal size by swallowing water or air when threatened.
A delicacy popular in Japan, consisting of the fish served raw as sushi or perhaps fried. It may, if improperly prepared, contain considerably deadly levels of neurotoxins.
A low, mournful sound uttered in pain or grief.
A low, guttural sound uttered in frustration, disapproval, or ecstasy.
(of an object) A low creaking sound from applied pressure or weight.
To make a groan.
definitions.example: The wooden table groaned under the weight of the banquet.

definitions.definition: To strive after earnestly, as if with groans.
To remove dust from.
definitions.example: The cleaning lady needs a stool to dust the cupboard.

definitions.definition: To remove dust; to clean by removing dust.
definitions.example: Dusting always makes me cough.

definitions.definition: Of a bird, to cover itself in sand or dry, dusty earth.
To spray or cover something with fine powder or liquid.
definitions.example: The mother dusted her baby's bum with talcum powder.

definitions.definition: To leave; to rush off.
To reduce to a fine powder; to levigate.
To kill or severely disable.
A light snowfall.
A light covering of something.
definitions.example: Cover the cake with a dusting of confectioner's sugar.

definitions.definition: The act of removing dust, as a household chore.
definitions.example: Tuesday is the day when I do the dusting.

definitions.definition: A beating.
A branch of mathematics studying those properties of a geometric figure or solid that are not changed by stretching, bending and similar homeomorphisms.
A collection τ of subsets of a set X such that the empty set and X are both members of τ, and τ is closed under finitary intersections and arbitrary unions.
The anatomical structure of part of the body.
The arrangement of nodes in a communications network.
The properties of a particular technological embodiment that are not affected by differences in the physical layout or form of its application.
(topography) The topographical study of geographic locations or given places in relation to their history.
The art of, or method for, assisting the memory by associating the thing or subject to be remembered with some place.
Someone advertising for customers in an aggressive way.
definitions.example: Be careful of the ticket touts outside the arena, they are famed for selling counterfeits.

definitions.definition: A person, at a racecourse, who offers supposedly inside information on which horse is likely to win.
A spy for a smuggler, thief, or similar.
An informer in the Irish Republican Army.
To flaunt, to publicize/publicise; to boast or brag; to promote.
definitions.example: Mary has been touted as a potential succesor to the current COE.

definitions.definition: To look upon or watch.
To spy out information about (a horse, a racing stable, etc.).
To give a tip on (a racehorse) to a person, with the expectation of sharing in any winnings.
To spy out the movements of racehorses at their trials, or to get by stealth or other improper means the secrets of the stable, for betting purposes.
To act as a tout; to give a tip on a racehorse.
To look for, try to obtain; used with for.
Not able to be controlled, contained or governed.
